course_title: Topics in Jewish History: Women&Early Mod.Courts of Law
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 13Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as HIST 385 1)


How did women navigate justice and injustice in courts of law in Europe between 1300 and 1800? What strategies did they develop to cope with legal situations that impacted themselves, their families, and communities? How did they navigate marriage and divorce laws and matters that pertain to family law? Were women engaged in crime? In this class, students explore these questions and assess women's access to the law, their agency through legal processes, and their marginalization. Students will examine these questions as lens into power relations as well as broader legal, religious, and social developments in this time period.
course_description: This course will focus on a specific period or dimension of Jewish history with an emphasis on the use of documents and other primary sources. Topics will vary.
